items.title: Truck company has some convictions dropped over 2014 fatal Adelaide crash
items.description: Cleanaway Operations has had six of its eight convictions relating to a fatal crash on Adelaide's South-Eastern Freeway set aside following an appeal.
items.content: Cleanaway Operations has had six of its eight convictions relating to a fatal crash on Adelaide's South-Eastern Freeway set aside following an appeal.

items.title: Another Gold Coast construction company collapses amid rising costs
items.author: Heidi Sheehan
items.description: The managing director of Pivotal Homes says employees and contractors have been paid in full, but that operations are unviable due to a set of circumstances he has never seen in the industry.
items.content: The managing director of Pivotal Homes says employees and contractors have been paid in full, but that operations are unviable due to a set of circumstances he has never seen in the industry.

items.title: 'I will recover loudly so others don't die silently': Queensland MP shares story of child sexual abuse
items.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis
items.description: Queensland MP Melissa McMahon reveals her harrowing experiences as a victim of child sexual abuse in a bid to raise awareness and inspire other victims to speak out.
items.content: Queensland MP Melissa McMahon reveals her harrowing experiences as a victim of child sexual abuse in a bid to raise awareness and inspire other victims to speak out.

items.title: Boeing's Starliner completes 'incredible' test flight
items.description: NASA calls the test flight, featuring a dummy called Rosie the Rocketeer, extremely successful.
items.content: NASA calls the test flight, featuring a dummy called Rosie the Rocketeer, extremely successful.

items.title: Homeless issue could change how Queenslanders should live.
items.author: Brad Marsellos
items.description: Homeless issue could change how Queenslanders should live.
items.content: Homeless issue could change how Queenslanders should live.

items.title: Whistleblowers' and journalists' sources protected under new laws passed in Queensland
items.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis
items.description: The laws – known as shield laws – prevent journalists from being compelled to reveal the identity of their sources during court proceedings, and come as part of a package of reforms passed in Queensland Parliament today.
items.content: The laws – known as shield laws – prevent journalists from being compelled to reveal the identity of their sources during court proceedings, and come as part of a package of reforms passed in Queensland Parliament today.

items.title: Former reality star Josh Duggar jailed for more than 12 years over child abuse material
items.description: The eldest child of the conservative Duggar family, who rose to fame in TLC's '19 Kids and Counting', was sentenced to 151 months in jail on Wednesday.
items.content: The eldest child of the conservative Duggar family, who rose to fame in TLC's '19 Kids and Counting', was sentenced to 151 months in jail on Wednesday.

items.title: Pubs with no beer in mining city count the cost of two big power outages this week
items.author: Jarrod Lucas and Asha Couch
items.description: Business owners in WA's Goldfields say they are thousands of dollars out of pocket due to extended blackouts on Sunday and Wednesday, and are calling on Western Power to fix the issues with its network.
items.content: Business owners in WA's Goldfields say they are thousands of dollars out of pocket due to extended blackouts on Sunday and Wednesday, and are calling on Western Power to fix the issues with its network.

items.title: On a roll: Aussie-made toilet paper, tissues secure on the shelves as supply chain disruptions wreak havoc
items.author: Grace Whiteside
items.description: An Australian mill is reaping the reward of supply chain disruptions, reporting a 10 per cent increase in demand.
items.content: An Australian mill is reaping the reward of supply chain disruptions, reporting a 10 per cent increase in demand.

items.title: 'An exciting time for Australian politics': Teal independent Kate Chaney claims victory in blue-ribbon Curtin
items.author: Nicolas Perpitch
items.description: Independent Kate Chaney wins the prized Perth seat of Curtin and says a 15 per cent swing against the Liberals "sends a really strong message that communities want to see politics done differently".
items.content: Independent Kate Chaney wins the prized Perth seat of Curtin and says a 15 per cent swing against the Liberals "sends a really strong message that communities want to see politics done differently".
